2 hours ago, Ignath said:

I just realized it was an issue with CKAN which was messing with PlanetShine folder structure, I sent them a pull request to fix it.

In the meantime you can fix it easily by fixing the folders according to that:

The intended folder structure is:

  • GameData
    • PlanetShine
      • Config
      • Icons
      • Plugins

However currently CKAN is giving this unintended result:

  • GameData
    • PlanetShine
      • Config
      • PlanetShine
        • Icons
        • Plugins

Thanks!  I had fixed it myself by doing the same thing, but figured I'd let you know that I grabbed it from CKAN as that was likely the issue.

There are two versions of this one CKAN.  one of them has "default configuration" after it.  Is default configuration your suggest config?  Or does that set something else back to default?  Just wondering which to use.  Normally I install mods on my own but have been trying out CKAN lately and some of its quirks confuse me

7 hours ago, jpinard said:

There are two versions of this one CKAN.  one of them has "default configuration" after it.  Is default configuration your suggest config?  Or does that set something else back to default?  Just wondering which to use.  Normally I install mods on my own but have been trying out CKAN lately and some of its quirks confuse me

When you install PlanetShine with CKAN it will automatically force you to install either "PlanetShine - default configuration" or "Astronomer's pack - PlanetShine configuration".

This is working that way because some visual packs are changing the configuration of PlanetShine to a custom one, so currently PlanetShine on CKAN has been split in two mandatory parts, the core and the configuration, and currently the only visual pack providing a custom configuration is Astronomer's pack.

So yes, install the default configuration, and anyway it's entirely tweakable or resettable to the true original defaults from within the game.

Edited April 23, 2016 by Valerian

So yes, install the default configuration, and anyway it's entirely tweakable or resettable to the true original defaults from within the game.

Actually it was not me who splitted PlanetShine like that, but the people who were maintaining CKAN. And the person who is responsible of "Astronomer's pack - PlanetShine configuration" is Astronomer. His pack is not yet compatible with the latest version of KSP (1.1).

Edited April 23, 2016 by Valerian

@Valerian I have a feature request.  Can you add an option to remove the button from flight mode.  This would require you add the button to the space center scene so we can re-gain access, but for the most part PlanetShine is like Distant Object Enhancement, once you get the settings where you want them you probably aren't going to click that button ever again and it just adds clutter to the toolbar.  This would default with the button visible in flight of course. (DOE has a similar feature as well, basically I want you to mimic that feature)

3 hours ago, Alshain said:

@Valerian I have a feature request.  Can you add an option to remove the button from flight mode.  This would require you add the button to the space center scene so we can re-gain access, but for the most part PlanetShine is like Distant Object Enhancement, once you get the settings where you want them you probably aren't going to click that button ever again and it just adds clutter to the toolbar.  This would default with the button visible in flight of course. (DOE has a similar feature as well, basically I want you to mimic that feature)

I might do it if I start working again on PlanetShine, but it's not a priority.

You can achieve the same effect if you use the Toolbar plugin, which PlanetShine supports, and there will be an option in PlanetShine to remove the button from the stock button bar and use the Toolbar plugin instead. Then within the Toolbar plugin you can decide what you want to display or not, and when.

Hello and beware it's newbie-alert.

I got an issue and I'm not sure if it's Planet Shine or RSS.

 

Just check these screenshots, they show the issue clearly:

Spoiler

I posted this on the threads for PS and RSS.

 

Edit:

I recognized something.

When I start the game and directly load the last save, it's okay.

When I exit to main menu, change any graphics setting (back and forth), apply, accept and load the save game again, this issue occurs...

It also happens just entering the VAB and leaving it...

I tried -force-opengl and -force-d3d11, with and without -popupwindow, with FULLSCREEN = True and FULLSCREEN = False ...

Also hovering the mouse cursor over the several buildings shows me that they're showing the tool tips of other buildings, so something is misaligned...

Edited May 1, 2016 by Gordon Dry
